title: Permabanned Incorrectly for 3rd Party Software
body:
So today i tried to log into my account and much to my surprise i have been banned permanently for "use of malicious 3rd party programs or modifications to your League of Legends client."  This ban is completely unjustified as i have never used any 3rd party programs or messed around with the games files or client. I also am the only one to ever access the account and have never used a boosting service that may have used 3rd party software on the account. The ban completely dumbfounds me and is 100% a mistake.  I have spent so much time and money on that account only to have it taken away in a mistake.

I made a support ticket explaining the situation but have yet to receive a response. I also have noticed several other players seem to be dealing with the same issue as me. It seems Riot has banned quite a few accounts incorrectly for 3rd party program use in their latest ban wave. If anyone has any suggestions for what i should do to get my account back please let me know. This is bullshit.

Edit 1: Just got a seemingly automated response from Riot saying this. 
"Our system has accurate evidence that your account was in violation of our Terms of Use due to the usage of scripts, hacks, exploits or unauthorized third-party programs in the game. After I double checked your account, it doesn't look like this was a mistake.

For security purposes on our investigative methods, I will not be sharing more detailed evidence or specific details. We will not be lifting the ban on this account under any circumstances. "

I am absolutely crushed. As i said before, I have never, NEVER, used any 3rd party software or messed with the client. This is 100% a mistake and now it seems my account is gone. I have no idea what do, possibly pursue legal action? Let me know if anyone knows what to do.

replies.body: When you get an automated response you just have to respond to that. The automated message is mostly to help clear things, but if you still have questions all you have to do is respond to the auto-message and you should get a real Rioter.
When you say respond, do you mean via the email they sent or should i file another support ticket? Thanks for the help.

> [{quoted}](name=Evan PogChamp,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=rUd7nuIA,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-04-11T23:39:20.004+0000)
>
> When you say respond, do you mean via the email they sent or should i file another support ticket? Thanks for the help.

Sending a new ticket will just set it as exactly that: a new ticket and will be treated that way, with a standard form letter response.

Responding the the email will keep your current ticket open. Staying polite with your own responses will also get you farther with your inquiries.

They dont need to announce anything, they are all a matter of public record. But there arent any, because the ToS will defeat any lawyer you can hire. The filing fees alone are probably higher than the "value" of most players accounts.

True a contract is only good if it has legal backing, however, the account and all items on it are Riot's. This would not be successful and depending on the state it was filed in, could likely harm OP if he were to pursue legal action.

What legal action would you pursue?  In order to file a lawsuit you need to have damages.  So, what are your damages?  You paid for content for which you received access to, you agreed that "at any time, for any reason" Riot games may terminate your account.  

You'd have no case, sorry.

To add to that, Riot completely stops working with you if you threaten legal action, only working with your lawyer taking to their lawyer from then on. 

Some people have been seeing 3rd party bans overruled lately, just be patient and keep replying.
